metadata.name: Poems in the Public Domain: "Fabliau of Florida" (IGNITE 2023 Special Edition)
metadata.description:
Wallace Stevens’ poem “Fabliau of Florida” is a special edition from Ana María Caballero and hieroglyphica’s sold-out generative collection POEMS IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN [PITPD]. This artwork was live-coded during South Florida's IGNITE Art + Tech Festival in January 2023, during which participants submitted comments that were incorporated into the project’s algorithm to create this unique, hand-annotated poem.

***  
NOTE: This piece is a live generative animation. If you are on a platform that does not support HTML tokens and are seeing only the preview GIF, you can view the actual token at the "animation_url" listed in the metadata.  
***

PITPD explores authorship. When a poem enters the public domain, it no longer belongs to its author but to its readers. In the intimate moments we read a poem, we link it to our private, pulsating worlds & help ensure others will read it, too. If history’s palms hadn’t held Sappho’s words, our fingers wouldn’t be holding them now.

The verses vanish – just like our memory of their exact words might fade – but distilled, standout moments of personal connection remain. In time, even these wane, providing a scarcely perceptible backdrop as the poem is discovered & interpreted anew. In this way, PITPD represents a new form of poetic anthology – one that celebrates the role of the reader in shaping the life of a poem. More information about the project can be found in our companion article: https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/poems-in-the-public-domain-marginalia-as-living-verse
